Title: Wear It All Luxury Opens New Abuja Boutique with Star-Studded Ceremony
Summary: Wear It All Luxury, the upscale fashion brand owned by renowned entrepreneur, Sodiq Babatunde Rufai, has expanded its presence with the launch of its Abuja boutique . Four years after successfully reopening its flagship store in Lekki Phase 1, Lagos, following a major renovation .

Title: Saudis in ‘difficult’ talks to keep Ronaldo next season: PIF source
Summary: Saudi Arabian officials are in ‘difficult’ talks to keep Cristiano Ronaldo in the country, a source with knowledge of the negotiations told AFP . Ronaldo suggested he was leaving Al Nassr on Thursday . “There is an ongoing difficult conversation,’s PIF source said .

Title: Africa’s next ‘super banker’: Who is running?
Summary: Five candidates are in the running to succeed Nigeria’s Akinwumi Adesina as president of the African Development Bank . Amadou Hott (Senegal) – Hott was Senegal's economy minister from 2019 to 2022 under the presidency of Macky Macky .

Title: Africa elects its next ‘super banker’
Summary: Race to become Africa’s next ‘super banker’ ends on Thursday . Five candidates, including one woman, vying to succeed Akinwumi Adesina as head of the African Development Bank .

Title: China condemns ‘discriminatory’ US plan to revoke student visas
Summary: The US will also revise visa criteria to tighten checks on all future applications from China and Hong Kong, Secretary of State Marco Rubio said . China condemns ‘discriminatory’ US plan to revoke student visas .

Title: Just in: Bandits invade palace, abduct traditional ruler in night attack in Nasarawa.
Summary: The CP has assured that the royal father would be rescued but called on anyone with useful information not to hesitate to report to the police . “The royal father will be rescued,” the CP said .

Title: We’re working end Nigeria’s dependence on imported drugs  —  Health Minister
Summary: Federal Government is making serious efforts to break Nigeria’s pharmaceutical dependency on foreign countries . Professor Muhammad Ali Pate, the Coordinating Minister of Health and Social Welfare, has said that Nigeria is working to end its dependence on imported drugs .

Title: Gospel singer Big Bolaji buried in Ibadan
Summary: Popular Nigerian gospel artiste, Bolaji Olanrewaju, popularly known as Big Bolaji, has been laid to rest in Ibadan, Oyo State, following his death on April 19 after a brief illness . The final rites began on Wednesday with a funeral service and lying-in-state held at the Hall

Title: PHOTO: Examination hall collapses on WASSCE candidates in Taraba
Summary: Dozens of students sitting for the ongoing West African Senior School Certificate Examination at Government Secondary School, Namnai, in Gassol Local Government Area of Taraba State narrowly escaped death on Wednesday evening . Title: Nigerian pilgrim returns missing $5,000 to owner in Saudi
Summary: A Nigerian pilgrim, Hajiya Zainab, from Plateau State, has returned $5,000 (about ₦8.2 million) she found at Masjidul Haram in Makkah to its rightful owner, a Russian pilgrim . Meanwhile, NAHCON says it is in talks with Saudi authorities

Title: Stop 'reckless' borrowing now, Atiku tells Tinubu

Title: Nigerians reaping gains of Tinubu's reforms -Ododo
Summary: Kogi State Governor, Ahmed Ododo, has congratulated President Bola Tinubu on the occasion of his second year in office .
